Dear Mr. Holt:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon Mavis, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10169 Discipline
Section (1) A facility shall have and follow written policy and procedure
Description which stipulates that residents shall not be subjected to any of the
following: (a) Corporal or cruel punishment.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/5/23, a staff member engaged in a physical altercation with a
youth at the facility. Staff member chased youth and put youth into
a headlock.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at
the facility on 5/9/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker.
Administrator 2 was not present or working at the time of the
incident. However, she interviewed all four youth and Staff 2 about
the incident on 5/8/23. Administrator 2 reported the camera
system does not consistently record any longer, so Supervisor 1
used her phone to record the video from the monitoring system.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/9/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported everyone
in the pod was playing around most of the day. After Youth A got
out of the shower, he saw Youth C messing around with Staff 1.
Staff 1 got up from the chair and Youth C fell backwards. Youth A
thought when Youth C feel it was because Staff 1 pushed him, so
Youth A went to the side of Staff 1, tapped his face, and kept
jogging forward. Youth A reported as he was jogging forward,
Staff 1 threw a Nintendo Switch remote at him, it hit the wall, and it
shattered. Youth A reported Staff 1 began chasing him around the
pod area and finally caught up with him. Youth A reported Staff 1
put his arm around Youth A’s neck, and he did not feel pressure
because he had so much adrenaline, but he heard from the other
youth his face was turning red. When Staff 1 had his arm around
Youth A’s neck, Staff 1 stated “I told you to stop playing with me”
over and over. Youth A stated when other staff entered the room,
they immediately began grabbing Youth A's legs because they
thought Youth A was in the wrong. After the other staff restrained
him, Staff 1 walked away. When the other staff found out Youth A
was not in the wrong, they guided him to his room, and he
received a punishment for 24 hours of room time. Youth A
reported Staff 1 plays around with them physically often, so Youth
A was shocked it became serious and Staff 1 took it so far. Youth
A reported Staff 1 frequently says things like “shut the fuck up or
you’ll go to your room” or “shut the fuck up or I’ll beat your ass”.
2

Youth A reported he has never reported it before because he
never took Staff 1 seriously.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/10/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported after he
and the other youth came back from the student commons, the
youth took turns to completing their showers while other youth
played video games with staff. Youth B reported Youth A got out
of the shower and was in a very playful mood. Youth B reported
while he, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth C were playing video games,
Youth A began trying to roughhouse with Staff 1. Staff 1 asked
Youth A to stop playing around. Shortly after, Youth C also joined
in trying to play around with Staff 1. Youth B stated Youth A said,
“I can fight anyone” and continued to try to roughhouse with Staff
1. Youth B reported Staff 1 continued to ask them to stop. Youth B
reported he also told the other youth to chill out and stop so they
did not get in trouble for horseplay. Youth C tapped Staff 1, Staff 1
stood up from his chair, and Youth C fell backwards. Youth A then
tapped Staff 1 on the face and Staff 1 got mad. Staff 1 then went
after Youth A and told Youth A he was playing too much. Staff 1
threw a Nintendo Switch remote at Youth A, but it hit the wall
instead. At first, Youth B thought they were playing around, but
then when he got up, he saw Staff 1 was choking Youth A by
holding one arm around his neck and having his other hand at
Youth A’s throat. Youth B reported Staff 1’s face was red, and his
veins were popping out of his neck, so it was obvious he was
angry. Youth B reported Youth A’s face was also red when Staff 1
was holding him in a headlock. Youth B reported when he saw
how serious it was, he grabbed Staff 1 around his waist and tried
pulling him off Youth A. While he was trying to pull him off, Youth
B said he told Staff 1 to chill out because it was not serious. Youth
B said after the incident, Youth A told Staff 1 “I got something for
you when I get out” and was cussing at him. Youth B said Staff 1
then told Youth A “careful what you wish for and careful what
you’re saying because there are microphones on the wall”.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/10/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported he,
Youth B, Staff 1, and Staff 2 were playing video games when
Youth A got out of the shower and was trying to horseplay with
Staff 1. Youth C reported Youth A ran up to Staff 1 and tapped
him. Youth C reported Staff 1 then chased Youth A to the
whiteboard at the end of the room. Staff 1 repeated “stop playing”
to them but didn’t give any consequences for what would happen
if they would stop so they didn’t take Staff 1 seriously. Youth C
reported he then tapped Staff 1’s arm. When Staff 1 stood up,
3

Youth C reported he fell backwards because he did not expect
Staff 1 to stand up. Youth A then tapped Staff 1 on his face and
ran away. Staff 1 started running after Youth A and threw the
Nintendo Switch remote at Youth A, but it hit the wall instead.
Youth B reported when Staff 1 caught Youth A, Staff 1 started
choking Youth A with his arm around his neck so that’s how the
other youth knew things were serious. Youth C reported Youth A's
face was red and his veins were popping out on his face. Youth C
reported Youth A was not fighting against Staff 1 or being
aggressive towards Staff 1 at all. Youth C reported he and Youth
B told Staff 1 “chill out! It’s not that serious”, but he wouldn’t
release Youth A. Youth C reported he grabbed Staff 1’s arm and
Youth B grabbed Staff 1 around his waist to try and get him off
Youth A. Youth C reported he then yelled at Staff 2 to come help
because he was still sitting down where they were playing video
games. Staff 1 came to their rooms later that night and Youth C
reported he asked Staff 1 what happened. Youth C reported Staff
1 responded he blacked out. Youth C reported Youth A was really
upset because he was serving a room time punishment after Staff
1 became too physical with him, so he was yelling and cussing at
Staff 1. Youth C reported Staff 1 told Youth A “everyone has
access to a 9 mm gun”. Youth C reported this is not the first time
they have horse played with Staff 1, but this is the first time it has
gotten serious. Youth C reported Staff 1 has frequently told the
youth “I’ll beat your ass”, but they took it as Staff 1 playing around.
Youth C reported Staff 1 is too comfortable with the youth in his
position and frequently cusses at them and calls them profane
names like “hoes”.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/10/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported on 5/5/23,
he was working on A-Pod. Staff 1 said earlier in the day, Youth C
tried to play fight with him in the student commons and Staff 1 told
Youth C to back off, but he did not give Youth C room time
consequently like he should have. Staff 1 reported Youth C was
trying to goof off and he knows Youth C wasn’t trying to make it a
serious situation or provoke him. Staff 1 said he should not give so
many chances to Youth C, but he did, and he regretted it. Staff 1
said everyone went back to the pod and the youth started taking
showers. Staff 1, Staff 2, Youth B and Youth C were playing video
games on the Nintendo Switch in the common area of the pod.
Staff 1 said Youth A took his shower first and when he got out of
the shower, he said he could beat Staff 1 up in a playful manner.
Staff 1 said he knew Youth A was playing around and wasn’t
serious, so Staff 1 replied “I’m not doing that with you [Youth A]”.
After Staff 1 replied to Youth A, Youth A began to instigate Youth
4

C to start playing around with Staff 1 too, so then both youths
were picking at him. Staff 1 reported Youth C kept pausing the
video game and Staff 1 asked Youth C to chill out because they
were just supposed to be having a fun, relaxing day. Staff 1
reported he told the youth about 8 times to stop, and he wasn’t
playing around anymore, but they wouldn’t stop. Youth D touched
Staff 1’s face and Youth B told Youth D to stop, so Youth D
stopped immediately. Staff 1 reported Youth A kept escalating the
situation by continuing to touch him and encourage Youth C to do
the same. Staff 1 reported Youth C came up to him and Staff 1
accidently stepped on Youth C’s foot while he was trying to stand
up, so Youth C fell backwards, and Staff 1 was standing over him.
Staff 1 said Youth A came around his side and tapped Staff 1 on
his face and ran forward. Staff 1 reported given Youth B and
Youth C’s histories of violence, Staff 1 went into defense mode
and his mind flipped. Staff 1 reported as Youth A ran, Staff 1 threw
the Nintendo Switch video game controller at Youth A and he
reported his intention was to hit Youth A because he was mad.
The controller ended up hitting the wall, and then Staff 1 said he
went up to Youth A and said “I told you I was not playing with you.
How many times do I have to say that?” Staff 1 reported Youth A
was laughing. Staff 1 reported he was in a defensive position with
Youth A in front of him and Youth C behind him. Staff 1 reported
based on their violent histories, Staff 1 wasn’t sure what was
going to happened. Staff 1 reported he leaned over Youth A and
held his arm around Youth A’s neck to hold him in a control hold
position, which he learned in his martial arts Jujitsu training. Staff
1 reported he was sure not to put pressure on Youth A’s neck,
choke him or hurt him and made sure he was breathing the whole
time. Staff 1 referred to the situation with Youth A as “one-on-one
combat”. Staff 1 reported he then heard someone else call a Level
1 emergency on the radio, which caused him to feel more relaxed
and relieved because he was going to receive help. Staff 1 stated
he didn’t want to let go of Youth A because, in his experience, if a
staff member lets go too soon, a youth will beat up or attack a staff
member when they’re mad. Staff 1 reported he held onto Youth A
until other staff arrived and restrained Youth A. Staff 1 reported he
left the room after Youth A was restrained and doesn’t know what
happened after he left. Staff 1 reported later in the night, he went
to the hallway outside the youths’ bedrooms to talk to Youth A.
Staff 1 stated Youth A threatened him by saying “just wait until
September when I get out. I know your work hours and I’ll pop
you”. Staff 1 reported Youth C was trying to talk to him because
he thought he was in trouble for what happened, and even during
the conversation with Youth C, Youth A was trying to instigate and
escalate things. Staff 1 reported he told Youth A “at the end of the
5

day, you have the freedom to do anything you want when you get
out” and then walked away. Staff 1 reported he made a mistake by
not calling for back-up as he should have called a supervisor since
it continued to escalate, and the youth wouldn’t stop. Staff 1 stated
he never asked Staff 2 to call for back up or help, which he also
should have done. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 was brand new, and he
didn’t feel he could trust him to help in the situation. Staff 1
reported if there was a veteran employee with him on staff, he felt
the situation would have gone differently. Staff 1 admitted he was
defensive in his reactions but kept trying to de-escalate the
situation by asking the youth to stop instead of issuing
consequences. Staff 1 reported nothing like this has ever
happened before and he’s never felt as angry. Staff 1 reported he
has always been calm when doing restraints and having
interactions with youth in the past. Staff 1 reported he felt he
couldn’t utilize CPI restraint training during the incident because
he wasn’t sure what the youth were trying to do, and he was very
defensive.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/10/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he has
been working at the facility for approximately 2 months. Staff 2
reported on 5/5/23, he was assigned to all of the pods at the
facility as a floater to help out and do visual 15-minute checks on
the youth. Staff 2 reported he was hanging out on A-pod and
playing video games with Staff 1, Youth B and Youth C until he
had to complete his next set of checks. Staff 2 reported Youth C
began poking at Staff 1’s face and Staff 2 couldn’t tell if Youth C
was messing around or not. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 told Youth C
to stop playing around, but he wouldn’t stop. Staff 2 reported Staff
1 asked the youth to stop playing and messing around 4-5 times,
but they wouldn’t stop. Staff 2 reported Youth A then tapped or
touched Staff 1’s face and Staff 1 took it seriously. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 threw the video game controller at Youth A, but Staff 2
couldn’t tell if it was out of frustration or anger. Staff 2 reported he
continued to sit in the video game area and couldn’t see
everything happening behind the white board when Staff 1 and
Youth A were across the room. Staff 2 reported he could not tell if
they were playing around or if it was serious, so he didn’t do
anything to stop the situation or get involved. Staff 2 reported he
then saw Staff 1’s restraint hold with his arm around Youth A’s
neck/shoulders, so Staff 2 felt things became more serious. Staff 2
reported he was overthinking everything and wasn’t sure what to
do in the situation, so he didn’t call for help or get up until the last
minute. Staff 2 reported by the time he got up, other staff were
already coming into the room. Staff 2 stated after the incident
6

occurred, he helped put the youth in their rooms and wrote his
incident report. Staff 2 reported he has never seen Staff 1 react
like that or interact with a youth at the facility like that before. Staff
2 reported Staff 1 appeared calm during the situation and did not
appear angry.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/10/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 heard a Level 1 call
on the radio and reported to A-pod immediately. When he entered
the pod, Staff 1 had Youth A in a control position in the chair. Staff
3 described Staff 1’s chest up against Youth A’s chest, with Staff
1’s head over Youth A’s left shoulder and Youth A’s arms up in the
air. Staff 1 reported this was not a CPI approved restraint
technique or anything they are taught at the facility. Staff 3
reported he went to assist Staff 1 because it looked like Staff 1
was the only employee in the room. He reported he later found out
Staff 2 was also in the room, but he initially thought Staff 2 was a
youth. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 told Youth A “I’m about to let you
go. Don’t hit me”. Staff 3 reported he could tell Staff 1 was fired up
because his ears were all red, but Staff 1 was not yelling and
appeared to have control of himself. Staff 3 reported once he and
Staff 4 were helping with Youth A, Staff 1 got up and left the pod.
Staff 3 reported Youth A was not aggressive or fighting against
them and he went to his room without issue.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/10/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he heard
the Level 1 call, so he reported immediately. When he entered the
room, Staff 1 had Youth A in a headlock in the corner. Staff 4
reported Youth A was laughing at the time, so Staff 4 could not tell
what was going on or what happened prior to cause Youth A’s
reaction. Staff 4 reported he asked Staff 2 to put the other youth in
their rooms. Staff 4 reported he and Staff 3 each held down one of
Youth A’s arms. Youth A told them “I was just playing around, but
[Staff 1] took it too far. You can let me go”. Staff 4 reported Staff 1
didn’t respond or say anything. Staff 4 was focused on Youth A,
so he isn’t sure if Staff 1 left on his own or if someone told him to
leave. Staff 4 reported he was focused on Youth A’s demeanor, so
he did not notice Staff 1’s demeanor. Staff 4 reported Youth A’s
body was tense, but he was not being aggressive or trying to fight
against them. Staff 4 said he and Staff 3 then escorted Youth A to
his room.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/10/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 heard the Level 1
call, so she reported to A-Pod immediately. When she walked
7

onto the pod, Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Supervisor 1 were
already present. Staff 3 and Staff 4 were holding Youth A down.
Staff 5 reported Staff 1 was very upset and kept repeating “you
don’t do that” speaking to Youth A, but she isn’t sure what Staff 1
was referring to. Staff 5 reported Staff 1 said he needed a minute
to breathe, and then he left the area.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
5/10/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported at 7:30 pm on 5/5/23 an employee on another pod called
a Level 1 notification on the radio for A-pod so she responded to
A-pod for assistance. When she arrived, Staff 1, Staff 3 and Staff
4 had Youth A restrained. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A was
sitting on the couch while Staff 3 and Staff 4 were each holding
one of his arms on the couch, so Supervisor 1 went to restrain his
ankles. She reported she was not sure what happened prior, but
Staff 1 was cussing and angry. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 said
something to the extent of “you’ve got the wrong damn staff”
towards Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported she did not hear anything
else he said clearly. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was not being
aggressive or trying to fight against staff, but his body was very
tense. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A also wasn’t saying anything
inappropriate towards staff. Supervisor 1 reported she asked for
another staff to have Staff 1 leave the area because after he
walked away from Youth A, he was too far away for Supervisor 1
to give the directive. Two minutes after Staff 1 left the room, Youth
A became less tense and asked if he could go to his room, so
Staff 3 and Staff 4 led him to his room using a 2 person CPI hold.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A went willingly to his room without
any issues. After the incident, Supervisor 1 went to the video
cameras to try and see what happened prior to the Level 1
notification call because the camera system is not working or
recording videos properly. Supervisor 1 said thankfully she was
able to rewind enough to get most of the incident pulled up, so she
recorded it on her phone for documentation. Supervisor 1 reported
she has seen Staff 1 become angry and upset before, but she has
never seen him go after a youth or try and hurt a youth.
Supervisor 1 reported when Staff 1 gets upset, it is very difficult to
calm him down. Supervisor 1 reported the restraint Staff 1
completed on Youth A prior to other staff arriving was not CPI
approved and was not something they are taught to do at the
facility. Supervisor 1 reported it was late at night when she got
done collecting everything regarding the incident, so she chose to
wait until the next day to report it to Administrator 2 rather than
trusting her gut and calling him the same night.
8

Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
5/10/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 was
the dayshift supervisor on 5/6/23. Supervisor 2 reported
Supervisor 1 told him about the incident during the shift change
debrief. Supervisor 1 told Supervisor 2 she hadn’t informed
Administrator 2 yet because by the time she finished all the
paperwork, it was late at night. Supervisor 2 instructed Supervisor
1 to text Administrator 2 to let him know she needed to speak to
him as soon as possible and Supervisor 1 agreed. Supervisor 2
reported Administrator 2 called to check on everything at the
facility around 1 pm on 5/6/23, so Supervisor 2 informed
Administrator 2 what happened the previous night. Supervisor 2
told Administrator 2 Staff 1 was on shift as the floater, but he did
not allow him to work on A-Pod due to the incident the previous
night. Administrator 2 stated Staff 1 needed to be put on
suspended leave and punch out, so Supervisor 2 let Staff 1 know
and escorted him out of the building. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1
did not argue and stated he was going to be honest because he
wished he’d handled things differently.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
5/9/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 2
reported the incident occurred on 5/5/23, but he wasn’t called after
it occurred, which should have happened because he is always on
call. He reported Supervisor 2 made him aware of the incident on
5/6/23 when he called up to the facility to see how things were
going. Administrator 2 reported Supervisor 2 told him what
happened the previous night and notified him Staff 1 was currently
on shift but was not with the same pod of youth. Administrator 2
instructed Supervisor 2 to escort Staff 1 out of the building and let
Staff 1 know he was on unpaid leave until further investigation
occurred.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video Footage from the A-pod commons dated 5/5/23 was
reviewed. There is no audio. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth C are all
viewed to be sitting in chairs and Youth D is standing behind them
when Youth A enters the room. Youth C stands up and jumps
towards Staff 1, while Youth A is behind Staff 1. Youth B was
hidden by the rolling white board but stands up and is to the front-
right of Staff 1. After Youth B stands up, Youth C sits back down in
his chair. Youth A is still located behind Staff 1. Youth B lowers
back down to the ground behind the rolling white board again.
Youth D comes into frame and stands next to Staff 2. Youth D and
Youth A both put their hands next to or on Staff 1’s face. It is
unknown from the video whether either youth makes physical
9

contact with Staff 1. Youth D then backs away. Staff 1 gets up
from his seat, turns around and pushes Youth A backwards. Youth
A then runs around the tables. Youth C gets up from his chair and
approaches Staff 1 and puts his hand towards him. It is unknown
whether he makes physical contact with Staff 1. Staff 1 steps
forward and Youth C falls backwards onto the ground. Youth A is
still by the tables which is to the back-right of Staff 1. Youth A then
goes around the table, approaches Staff 1, touches Staff 1’s face
with his hand and runs forward towards the wall. Youth B gets up
from the floor and is standing, while Youth C is still on the floor on
his back in front of Staff 1. Staff 1 throws an object at Youth A, but
it does not hit Youth A. Then Staff 1 steps over Youth C and goes
after Youth A. Staff 2 remained seated in the chair during the
entire course of events thus far. Youth A switches his direction,
runs to the right, behind the rolling white board, and Staff 1 chases
after him. Staff 1 then pins Youth A against the wall/windows and
puts his arm around Youth A’s neck, while his face is directly in
Youth A’s face. Youth A’s right arm is around Staff 1’s back. Youth
B stands up and walks towards Staff 1 and Youth A to watch.
Youth C gets up from the floor and sits down in a chair watching
Staff 1 and Youth A. Youth D stands behind Youth C and watches
the interaction between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A uses his
hands to attempt to pull Staff 1’s body off him, but Staff 1 does not
let go right away. After a few seconds, Staff 1 releases his arm
from around Youth A’s neck. Staff 1 and Youth A have their arms
and hands interlocked and are pushing each other. Then Staff 1
reaches his arm around Youth A’s neck again and Youth A’s arm
is around Staff 1’s back. Staff 2 remains seated in his chair and
doesn’t physically check on anything occurring on the other side of
the room. Youth C remains sitting in a chair, while Youth B and
Youth D are watching Staff 1 and Youth A’s interactions. Staff 1
swings Youth A’s body around a couple times with his arm still
around Youth A’s neck. Youth B gets close to them and attempts
to separate Staff 1 and Youth A by getting in between them and
subsequently trying to pull Staff 1 off Youth A. Staff 1 and Youth A
go into the corner, out of camera view. Once Staff 1 and Youth A
are in the corner, Youth C and Staff 2 get out of their chairs and
approach the situation. Youth B, Youth C and Staff 2 are all seen
bent over, but it is unknown what they are doing or what position
Staff 1 and Youth A are in because it is outside of the camera’s
view.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident Report dated 5/5/23 written by Staff 1 gives Staff
1’s account about what happened prior to and during his
altercation with Youth A. It is somewhat consistent with
10

Staff 1’s interview. However, in the incident report, Staff 1
provides more details about what he and the youth said to
each other and leaves out details surrounding how he
restrained Youth A.
• Incident Reports dated 5/5/23 completed by Staff 3 and
Supervisor 1 were consistent with their respective
interviews.
• Incident Report dated 5/5/23 completed by Staff 4 was
somewhat consistent with his interview. However, Staff 4
noted in his interview Youth A was laughing during the
incident after other staff entered the room, which is not
noted in the incident report. In addition, Staff 4 noted in the
incident report when he entered the room, Youth A had his
hands locked around Staff 1’s head, which was not
mentioned during his interview.
• Incident Report dated 5/5/23 completed by Staff 2 was not
consistent with his interview. Staff 2 noted in his incident
report Staff 1 pushed Youth A towards the beginning of the
incident, which was not part of his interview. In addition,
Staff 2 noted when Staff 1 restrained Youth A, he
restrained him against the wall, which was not part of his
interview. Lastly, Staff 2 reported he helped Staff 1 restrain
Youth A, which was not part of anyone’s interview,
including Staff 2.
• Interview with Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D
completed and typed by Administrator 2. Youth A, Youth B,
Youth C and Youth D all noted they were horseplaying
back and forth with Staff 1 all day. Youth D stated Staff 1’s
“face was all red; he just wasn’t right” during the incident
with Youth A.
• Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home Policy 5.10: Non-Violent
Restraint states staff should only use the minimum amount
of force necessary to control the youth and move the youth
to a secure room. Staff should ensure safety, security, and
care of all involved. Youth Specialist should assess the
situation considering placement of all parties and needed
response time. Staff should call for assistance.
• Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home Policy 7.12: Use of
Force states staff should use the minimal amount of force
11

necessary to control a youth and outlines levels of force
staff are allowed to utilize based on the circumstances.
• Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home Policy 2.19: Juvenile
Rights states youth have the right not to be subjected to
corporal punishment, intimidation, assault, or harm.
• Staff 1’s employee file contains two disciplinary memos
unrelated to this investigation. It also contains two emails
regarding performance related concerns. On 8/22/21, a
shift supervisor had to remind [Staff 1] “of boundaries and
not to play fight/horseplay with residents”. The shift
supervisor also notes she “helped [Staff 1] understand all
residents are looking at him and he doesn’t want to lead
them to believe this is ok. He understood”. On 8/19/22,
Administrator 2 authored an email noting a youth wrote a
grievance about Staff 1 calling him the N word while they
were playing cards. When Staff 1 came to discuss the
grievance with the youth, Staff 1 called the youth a “snitch”
